label: Grand Est
abstract: Grand Est ("Great East"; French pronunciation: [ɡʁɑ̃t‿ɛst] (); Alsatian: d'r Grossa Oschta; Moselle Franconian/Luxembourgish: de Grouss Osten; Rhine Franconian: de Groß Oschte; German: der Große Osten [dɛɐ̯ ˈɡʁoːsɐ ˈɔstn̩]) is an administrative region in northeastern France. It superseded three former administrative regions—Alsace, Champagne-Ardenne, and Lorraine—on 1 January 2016 under the provisional name of Alsace-Champagne-Ardenne-Lorraine (ACAL or, less commonly, ALCA), as a result of territorial reform which had been passed by the French legislature back in 2014.
